ground_truth: There is a drink in her hand, and a suitcase beside her on the bed. Bert enters her suite and confronts her. Sarah's voice is subdued, controlled. He stands over her, pulling a wad of bills from his pocket. He picks her up and tries to kiss her but she is cold and limp in his arms, so he lets go and she drops back on the bed. Then he turns and walks back into his room. She waits for a moment. Then she takes a cigarette out of a pack, gets up, and goes into his room. In the bathroom mirror, we see Bert asleep on his bed. The sheets are rumpled and tossed about. Then we see Sarah, in her slip, enter the bathroom and shut the door. Eddie is just getting back. He walks through the lobby, ignoring the uniformed policeman standing nearby, and stops at the desk. The concierge stares dumbly. The concierge hands it to him. Eddie walks quickly toward the elevators. He enters, sees the money on Sarah's bed, puts down his cue case, and turns to see a crowd in the adjoining room. Bert, laying in bed, talks to a plainclothesman who stands over him, taking notes. A photographer with a flash camera stands by the bathroom. Bert stops when he sees Eddie through the open door. A uniformed policeman bars Eddie's entrance. Eddie comes in. He looks at the detectives around Bert's bed. The photographer's bulb flashes as he takes a picture of the bathroom. Eddie pushes by the photographer, then stops as he sees Sarah's body laid out on the tiled floor. He drops to his knees beside her. Eddie reaches out to touch her, then pulls back his hand. Bert appears at the bathroom door behind him. Eyes closed, he writhes as he listens to Bert. Suddenly he uncoils and lunges at Bert, grasping him by the throat and pushing him back. A policeman untangles them, but Eddie breaks free. Minnesota Fats sits in his chair, engrossed in the afternoon paper. Big John is at a pool table, trying out a few shots. Bert, in dark glasses, stands near the cashier's cage, chucking dice into a leather shaker. The noise of the dice echoes in the slow, late afternoon gloom of Ames. When Bert sees Eddie push open the glass doors, he draws himself up fearfully like a turtle, and motions with his eyes to his men for protection. Eddie, his cue case tucked under his arm, walks straight toward him. He stops, stares at him for a moment, then turns and walks over to Minnesota Fats. Fats rises, ready to play. Eddie starts to screw his cue together. He turns to join Fats at the table.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: There exists a beverage in her grasp, and a valise next to her on the cot. Bert enters her chamber and challenges her. Sarah's tone is muted, restrained. He stands above her, extracting a bundle of banknotes from his pocket. He lifts her and attempts to embrace her but she is frigid and limp in his arms, so he releases her and she falls back on the cot. Then he turns and strides back into his quarters. She pauses for a moment. Then she removes a cigarette from a packet, rises, and proceeds into his quarters. In the restroom mirror, we observe Bert slumbering on his cot. The linens are disheveled and scattered about. Then we observe Sarah, in her undergarment, enter the restroom and close the portal. Eddie is just returning. He strides through the foyer, disregarding the uniformed officer standing nearby, and halts at the counter. The concierge gazes vacantly. The concierge hands it to him. Eddie strides swiftly toward the lifts. He enters, observes the currency on Sarah's cot, places down his cue case, and turns to notice a throng in the adjacent chamber. Bert, reclining in bed, converses with a plainclothesman who stands over him, jotting notes. A photographer with a flash camera stands by the restroom. Bert pauses when he observes Eddie through the ajar portal. A uniformed officer obstructs Eddie's entry. Eddie enters. He observes the investigators around Bert's cot. The photographer's bulb flashes as he captures an image of the restroom. Eddie pushes past the photographer, then halts as he observes Sarah's form laid out on the tiled ground. He drops to his knees beside her. Eddie extends a hand to touch her, then retracts his hand. Bert materializes at the restroom portal behind him. Eyes shut, he squirms as he listens to Bert. Abruptly he uncoils and lunges at Bert, clutching him by the throat and pushing him back. An officer disentangles them, but Eddie breaks free. Minnesota Fats sits in his seat, absorbed in the afternoon journal. Big John is at a billiard table, attempting a few shots. Bert, in dark spectacles, stands near the cashier's enclosure, tossing dice into a leather tumbler. The clatter of the dice reverberates in the slow, late afternoon murk of Ames. When Bert observes Eddie push open the glass portals, he draws himself up fearfully like a turtle, and signals with his eyes to his men for protection. Eddie, his cue case tucked under his arm, strides directly toward him. He halts, gazes at him for a moment, then turns and walks over to Minnesota Fats. Fats rises, ready to play. Eddie begins to assemble his cue. He turns to join Fats at the table.

To his knees, he drops beside her. His hand is reached out by Eddie to touch her, then he pulls back his hand. At the bathroom door behind him, Bert appears. In his chair, Minnesota Fats sits, engrossed in the afternoon paper. At a pool table, Big John tries out a few shots. test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: A drink in hand and a suitcase beside her, Sarah is confronted by Bert in her suite. Her voice is subdued. Bert stands over her, pulling out a wad of bills. He tries to kiss her, but she remains cold and limp, so he lets go, and she falls back on the bed. He returns to his room. After a moment, Sarah lights a cigarette, gets up, and enters his room. In the bathroom mirror, Bert is asleep on his bed, sheets rumpled. Sarah, in her slip, enters the bathroom and shuts the door. Eddie returns, walks through the lobby, ignoring a nearby policeman, and stops at the desk. The concierge hands him something. Eddie heads to the elevators, enters, sees money on Sarah's bed, and notices a crowd in the next room. Bert, in bed, talks to a plainclothesman taking notes. A photographer stands by the bathroom. Bert stops when he sees Eddie. A policeman bars Eddie's entrance, but he comes in, observing the detectives around Bert. The photographer's bulb flashes as he captures the bathroom. Eddie pushes past, stopping at Sarah's body on the floor. He kneels beside her, reaching out but pulling back. Bert appears at the door. Eddie, eyes closed, listens to Bert, then lunges at him, grasping his throat. A policeman separates them, but Eddie breaks free. Minnesota Fats reads the afternoon paper. Big John tries shots at a pool table. Bert, in dark glasses, stands near the cashier's cage, tossing dice. The dice echo in the slow afternoon gloom of Ames. Seeing Eddie enter, Bert draws up fearfully, signaling his men for protection. Eddie, cue case under his arm, walks toward him, stops, stares, then turns to Minnesota Fats, who rises, ready to play. Eddie assembles his cue and joins Fats at the table.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: There’s a drink in her hand and a suitcase on the bed. Bert enters and confronts Sarah, whose voice is calm. He pulls out money, lifts her, and tries to kiss her, but she’s unresponsive, so he lets her drop and walks away. She waits, takes a cigarette, rises, and enters his room. In the bathroom mirror, Bert sleeps amid messy sheets. Sarah, in her slip, enters and shuts the door. Eddie returns, passes a uniformed cop, and stops at the desk. The concierge hands him something. Eddie hurries to the elevators, sees money on Sarah’s bed, drops his cue case, and notices a crowd. Bert talks to a detective, a photographer waits. Bert stops when he sees Eddie. A cop blocks Eddie, who enters, sees the detectives, and watches the photographer’s flash. Eddie moves past and sees Sarah’s body on the tiled floor. He kneels, reaches out, then withdraws. Bert appears. Eyes shut, Eddie writhes, then lunges at Bert, choking him. A cop separates them, but Eddie escapes. Minnesota Fats reads his paper. Big John shoots pool. Bert, in dark glasses, throws dice. The sound echoes in gloomy Ames. Bert sees Eddie enter and signals his men. Eddie walks to him, stops, stares, then turns to Fats. Fats rises, ready. Eddie assembles his cue and joins him.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: In her hand, she holds a drink, and beside her on the bed lies a suitcase. Bert makes his entrance into her suite and confronts her directly. Sarah's voice is subdued and controlled, maintaining a calm demeanor. He stands over her, pulling a substantial wad of bills from his pocket. He attempts to pick her up and kiss her, but she remains cold and limp in his arms, so he releases her, and she drops back onto the bed. After this, he turns around and walks back into his own room. She waits for a brief moment. Then, she takes a cigarette out of a pack, rises from the bed, and proceeds into his room. In the bathroom mirror, we catch a glimpse of Bert, who is asleep on his bed. The sheets are rumpled and tossed about in disarray. Then, we see Sarah, dressed in her slip, as she enters the bathroom and shuts the door behind her. Meanwhile, Eddie is just returning. He walks through the lobby, paying no attention to the uniformed policeman standing nearby, and stops at the desk. The concierge stares at him dumbly. The concierge hands it to him, and Eddie walks quickly toward the elevators. He enters, notices the money on Sarah's bed, puts down his cue case, and turns to see a crowd gathered in the adjoining room. Bert, lying in bed, is talking to a plainclothesman who stands over him, taking notes diligently. A photographer with a flash camera stands by the bathroom, ready to capture the scene. Bert halts his conversation when he sees Eddie through the open door. A uniformed policeman bars Eddie's entrance, but Eddie comes in regardless. He looks at the detectives surrounding Bert's bed. The photographer's bulb flashes as he takes a picture of the bathroom. Eddie pushes past the photographer, then stops abruptly as he sees Sarah's body laid out on the tiled floor. He drops to his knees beside her, reaching out to touch her, then hesitates and pulls back his hand. Bert appears at the bathroom door behind him. With eyes closed, Eddie writhes as he listens to Bert. Suddenly, he uncoils and lunges at Bert, grasping him by the throat and pushing him back forcefully. A policeman intervenes to untangle them, but Eddie breaks free. Minnesota Fats sits in his chair, engrossed in the afternoon paper. Big John is at a pool table, trying out a few shots with practiced ease. Bert, wearing dark glasses, stands near the cashier's cage, chucking dice into a leather shaker. The noise of the dice echoes in the slow, late afternoon gloom of Ames. When Bert sees Eddie push open the glass doors, he draws himself up fearfully like a turtle retreating into its shell and motions with his eyes to his men for protection. Eddie, with his cue case tucked securely under his arm, walks straight toward him. He stops, stares at him for a moment, then turns and walks over to Minnesota Fats. Fats rises, ready to play, and Eddie starts to screw his cue together. He turns to join Fats at the table, prepared for the game ahead.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: In her delicate hand, she carefully holds onto a drink, and resting beside her on the soft bed lies a medium-sized suitcase. Bert makes his bold entrance into her spacious suite and directly confronts her with an unwavering gaze. Sarah's voice remains subdued and controlled, and she maintains a calm demeanor throughout the tense interaction. He stands assertively over her, pulling out a substantial wad of bills from his pocket in a way that suggests significance. He attempts to pick her up and kiss her passionately, but she remains cold and limp in his arms, so he releases her, allowing her to drop back onto the bed with a soft thud. After this encounter, he turns around and walks briskly back into his own room. She waits for a brief moment, contemplating her next move. Then, she takes a cigarette out of a pack with a deliberate motion, rises from the bed with a purposeful grace, and proceeds into his room. In the bathroom mirror, we catch a glimpse of Bert, who is stretched out asleep on his bed. The sheets around him are rumpled and tossed about in disarray, contributing to the scene's chaotic atmosphere. Then, we see Sarah, dressed simply in her slip, as she quietly enters the bathroom and shuts the door behind her with a gentle click. Meanwhile, Eddie is just returning. He walks through the bustling lobby, paying no attention to the uniformed policeman standing nearby, and stops at the concierge desk. The concierge stares at him dumbly, seemingly caught off guard. The concierge hands it to him, and Eddie walks quickly toward the elevators. He enters, notices the money laid out on Sarah's bed, puts down his cue case, and turns to see a crowd gathered in the adjoining room. Bert, lying comfortably in bed, is talking to a plainclothesman who stands over him, diligently taking notes. A photographer with a flash camera stands poised by the bathroom, ready to capture the unfolding scene. Bert halts his conversation abruptly when he sees Eddie through the open door. A uniformed policeman bars Eddie's entrance, but Eddie comes in regardless, determined. He looks at the detectives surrounding Bert's bed. The photographer's bulb flashes brightly as he takes a dramatic picture of the bathroom. Eddie pushes past the photographer with urgency, then stops abruptly as he sees Sarah's motionless body laid out on the tiled floor. He drops to his knees beside her, reaching out to touch her, then hesitates and pulls back his trembling hand. Bert appears at the bathroom door behind him. With eyes tightly closed, Eddie writhes as he listens to Bert's words. Suddenly, he uncoils and lunges powerfully at Bert, grasping him by the throat and pushing him back with force. A policeman intervenes quickly to untangle them, but Eddie breaks free with determination. Minnesota Fats sits comfortably in his chair, engrossed in the afternoon paper. Big John is at a pool table, trying out a few shots with practiced ease and precision. Bert, wearing mysterious dark glasses, stands near the cashier's cage, chucking dice into a leather shaker with a rhythmical gesture. The echoing noise of the dice fills the slow, late afternoon gloom of Ames. When Bert sees Eddie push open the gleaming glass doors, he draws himself up fearfully, much like a turtle retreating into its shell, and motions with his eyes to his men for protection. Eddie, with his trusty cue case tucked securely under his arm, walks straight toward him with purpose. He comes to a halt, stares intently at him for a moment, then turns and walks over to Minnesota Fats. Fats rises, ready and eager to play, and Eddie begins to screw his cue together methodically. He turns to join Fats at the table, fully prepared for the game ahead.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: In the dimly lit room, Sarah holds a drink in her hand, her fingers wrapped around the glass, while a suitcase rests beside her on the bed, its presence a silent testament to her intentions. The door opens, and Bert strides into her suite, his demeanor confrontational as he approaches her. Sarah's voice emerges, subdued and controlled, as she responds to his presence. Bert looms over her, reaching into his pocket to extract a wad of bills, the paper crinkling softly as he pulls it out. He bends down, attempting to lift her from the bed, his arms encircling her in an effort to kiss her, but she remains cold and unresponsive, her body limp in his embrace. Realizing her lack of reciprocation, he releases her, allowing her to fall back onto the bed with a soft thud. Turning away, he walks with deliberate steps back into his own room, leaving her behind. Sarah waits, her mind processing the encounter, before she reaches for a cigarette from a nearby pack. Rising from the bed, she moves with purpose into his room. In the bathroom mirror, Bert is reflected, asleep on his bed, the sheets around him rumpled and tossed, evidence of a restless slumber. Sarah, clad in her slip, enters the bathroom and quietly shuts the door behind her. Meanwhile, Eddie returns, his footsteps echoing through the lobby as he walks past a uniformed policeman, his presence ignored. He halts at the desk, where the concierge, momentarily dumbfounded, hands him an item. Eddie, with a sense of urgency, strides quickly toward the elevators. Upon entering, he notices the money strewn across Sarah's bed, places his cue case down, and turns his attention to the adjoining room, where a crowd has gathered. Bert lies in bed, conversing with a plainclothesman who stands over him, diligently taking notes. A photographer, equipped with a flash camera, positions himself by the bathroom, ready to capture the scene. Bert's words falter as he catches sight of Eddie through the open door. A uniformed policeman stands as a barrier, preventing Eddie's entrance, but Eddie pushes past, his eyes scanning the detectives surrounding Bert's bed. The photographer's bulb flashes, illuminating the bathroom as he captures an image. Eddie maneuvers around the photographer, only to halt abruptly as his gaze falls upon Sarah's lifeless body, laid out on the tiled floor. Overcome with emotion, he drops to his knees beside her, reaching out to touch her but hesitating, his hand recoiling. Bert appears at the bathroom door, his eyes closed, his body writhing as he listens to Bert's words. Suddenly, Eddie's restraint snaps, and he lunges at Bert, his hands finding Bert's throat as he pushes him back. A policeman intervenes, untangling them, but Eddie breaks free, his emotions unchecked. Elsewhere, Minnesota Fats sits in his chair, absorbed in the afternoon paper, while Big John is at a pool table, testing a few shots. Bert, now wearing dark glasses, stands near the cashier's cage, the sound of dice clattering into a leather shaker echoing in the slow, late afternoon gloom of Ames. As Eddie pushes open the glass doors, Bert's demeanor shifts, drawing himself up fearfully like a turtle retreating into its shell, signaling with his eyes to his men for protection. Eddie, with his cue case securely tucked under his arm, walks directly toward Bert, halting to stare at him momentarily before turning his attention to Minnesota Fats. Fats rises, prepared to engage in the game, as Eddie begins to assemble his cue, methodically screwing it together before joining Fats at the table, ready to play.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Sarah sits on the bed with a drink in hand and a suitcase beside her as Bert enters her suite and confronts her. Speaking in a subdued, controlled voice, she remains cold and limp when he attempts to kiss her, prompting him to let go and return to his room. After a moment, Sarah lights a cigarette, gets up, and follows him. In the bathroom mirror, Bert is seen asleep on his bed with rumpled sheets. Sarah, in her slip, enters the bathroom and shuts the door.

Meanwhile, Eddie returns, walking through the lobby and ignoring a nearby policeman. He stops at the desk, receives something from the concierge, and heads quickly to the elevators. Entering Sarah's room, he notices money on the bed, sets down his cue case, and turns to see a crowd in the adjoining room. Bert, in bed, talks to a plainclothesman taking notes, while a photographer stands by the bathroom. Spotting Eddie, Bert pauses, but a uniformed policeman blocks Eddie's entrance. Eddie pushes past, sees Sarah's body on the bathroom floor, and drops to his knees beside her, hesitating to touch her. Bert appears at the door, and Eddie, overwhelmed, lunges at him, grasping his throat until a policeman intervenes. Eddie breaks free.

Later, Minnesota Fats reads the afternoon paper while Big John practices pool shots. Bert, wearing dark glasses, stands near the cashier's cage, tossing dice. The noise echoes in the dim afternoon at Ames. Upon seeing Eddie enter, Bert signals his men for protection. Eddie, with his cue case under his arm, approaches Bert, pauses, then turns to Minnesota Fats, who rises, ready to play. Eddie assembles his cue and joins Fats at the table.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: There is a drink, likely bourbon based on the bottle in the room, in her hand, and a suitcase beside her on the bed. Bert, known for his rough demeanor, enters her suite and confronts her. Sarah's voice is subdued, controlled, a testament to her resolve despite the tense situation. He stands over her, pulling a wad of bills from his pocket, a hefty sum likely earned from gambling winnings. He picks her up and tries to kiss her but she is cold and limp in his arms, so he lets go and she drops back on the bed. Then, with frustration brewing, he turns and walks back into his room. She waits for a moment, the silence in the suite palpable. Then she takes a cigarette from a pack of Lucky Strikes, gets up, and goes into his room. In the bathroom mirror, we see Bert asleep on his bed, the exhaustion evident in his posture. The sheets are rumpled and tossed about, a sign of a restless night. Then we see Sarah, in her slip, enter the bathroom and shut the door. Eddie, notorious for his uncanny pool skills, is just getting back. He walks through the bustling hotel lobby, ignoring the uniformed policeman standing nearby, and stops at the desk. The concierge stares dumbly, unaccustomed to such charged encounters. The concierge hands it, a telegram from a pool tournament organizer, to him. Eddie walks quickly toward the elevators. He enters, sees the money on Sarah's bed, puts down his cue case, and turns to see a crowd in the adjoining room. Bert, laying in bed and barely awake, talks to a plainclothesman who stands over him, taking notes about the incident. A photographer with a vintage flash camera stands by the bathroom. Bert stops when he sees Eddie through the open door, his eyes narrowing. A uniformed policeman bars Eddie's entrance. Eddie comes in, his reputation for tenacity preceding him. He looks at the detectives around Bert's bed, their presence turning the room into a crime scene. The photographer's bulb flashes as he takes a picture of the bathroom, capturing every detail. Eddie pushes by the photographer, then stops as he sees Sarah's lifeless body laid out on the tiled floor. He drops to his knees beside her, grief-stricken. Eddie reaches out to touch her, then pulls back his hand, trembling with emotion. Bert appears at the bathroom door behind him. Eyes closed, he writhes as he listens to Bert, whose words are laced with mock concern. Suddenly he uncoils and lunges at Bert, grasping him by the throat and pushing him back. A policeman untangles them, but Eddie breaks free, his anger uncontainable. Minnesota Fats, legendary in the pool circuit, sits in his chair, engrossed in the afternoon paper. Big John is at a pool table, trying out a few shots, honing his skills. Bert, in dark glasses to conceal a black eye from an earlier altercation, stands near the cashier's cage, chucking dice into a leather shaker. The noise of the dice echoes in the slow, late afternoon gloom of Ames, an old-school pool hall renowned for its high-stakes games. When Bert sees Eddie push open the glass doors, he draws himself up fearfully like a turtle, and motions with his eyes to his men for protection. Eddie, his cue case tucked under his arm like a trusted companion, walks straight toward him. He stops, stares at him for a moment, then turns and walks over to Minnesota Fats. Fats rises, ready to play, the anticipation in the air thick. Eddie starts to screw his cue together, his hands steady with purpose. He turns to join Fats at the table, the promise of another thrilling match ahead.

Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. A uniformed policeman bars Eddie's entrance. Eddie comes in. He looks at the detectives around Bert's bed. The photographer's bulb flashes as he takes a picture of the bathroom. Eddie pushes by the photographer then stops as he sees Sarah's body laid out on the tiled floor. He drops to his knees beside her. Eddie reaches out to touch her then pulls back his hand. Bert appears at the bathroom door behind him. Eyes closed he writhes as he listens to Bert. Suddenly he uncoils and lunges at Bert grasping him by the throat and pushing him back. A policeman untangles them but Eddie breaks free. Minnesota Fats sits in his chair engrossed in the afternoon paper. Big John is at a pool table trying out a few shots. Bert in dark glasses stands near the cashier's cage chucking dice into a leather shaker. The noise of the dice echoes in the slow late afternoon gloom of Ames. When Bert sees Eddie push open the glass doors he draws himself up fearfully like a turtle and motions with his eyes to his men for protection. Eddie his cue case tucked under his arm walks straight toward him. He stops stares at him for a moment then turns and walks over to Minnesota Fats. Fats rises ready to play. Eddie starts to screw his cue together. He turns to join Fats at the table.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: There is a drink in her hand and a suitcase beside her on the bed. Bert enters her suite and confronts her. Sarah's voice is subdued controlled. He stands over her pulling a wad of bills from his pocket. He picks her up and tries to kiss her but she is cold and limp in his arms so he let us go and she drops back on the bed. Then he turns and walks back into his room. She waits for a moment. Then she takes a cigarette out of a pack gets up and goes into his room. In the bathroom mirror we see Bert asleep on his bed. The sheets are rumpled and tossed about. A policeman untangles them but Eddie breaks free. Minnesota Fats sits in his chair engrossed in the afternoon paper. Big John is at a pool table trying out a few shots. Bert in dark glasses stands near the cashier's cage chucking dice into a leather shaker. The noise of the dice echoes in the slow late afternoon gloom of Ames. When Bert sees Eddie push open the glass doors he draws himself up fearfully like a turtle and motions with his eyes to his men for protection. Eddie his cue case tucked under his arm walks straight toward him. He stops stares at him for a moment then turns and walks over to Minnesota Fats. Fats rises ready to play. Eddie starts to screw his cue together. He turns to join Fats at the table.

He stands over her pulling a wad of bills from his pocket. Eddie his cue case tucked under his arm walks straight toward him. He stops stares at him for a moment then turns and walks over to Minnesota Fats. Fats rises ready to play. Eddie starts to screw his cue together. He turns to join Fats at the table.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: There is a newspaper in her fist, and a backpack beneath her on the couch. Doug bursts into her cabin and debates with her. Linda's laughter is loud, unrestrained. He kneels beside her, extracting a feather from his hat. He lifts her up and attempts to dance with her but she is stiff and rigid in his grasp, so he releases her and she flops back on the couch. Then he spins and dashes back into his tent. She lingers for a while. Then she pulls a pen out of a box, stands up, and strolls into his tent. In the kitchen window, we notice Doug snoring in his hammock. The pillows are crumpled and scattered around. Then we catch sight of Linda, in her robe, entering the kitchen and locking the hatch. Frank is just arriving. He marches through the corridor, dismissing the suited guard leaning against the wall, and pauses at the counter. The receptionist gawks blankly. The receptionist passes it to him. Frank strides briskly towards the stairwell. He enters, spots the bracelet on Linda's couch, sets down his guitar case, and turns to observe a gathering in the neighboring space. Doug, reclining in the hammock, converses with a technician who looms over him, jotting notes. A journalist with a video camera stands by the kitchen. Doug halts when he notices Frank through the open hatch. A suited guard blocks Frank's passage. Frank enters. He gazes at the scribes around Doug's hammock. The journalist's device whirs as he records the kitchen. Frank squeezes past the journalist, then halts as he sees Linda's form arranged on the tiled counter. He drops to his knees beside her. Frank reaches out to touch her, then retracts his palm. Doug surfaces at the kitchen hatch behind him. Eyes shut, he shudders as he listens to Doug. Abruptly he springs forward and pounces on Doug, clutching him by the collar and shoving him backward. A technician separates them, but Frank breaks loose. Captain Crunch reclines on his bench, absorbed in the morning comic strip. Johnny Bravo is at a checkerboard, attempting a few moves. Doug, in a beanie hat, lounges near the teller's window, flipping coins into a velvet pouch. The clatter of the coins reverberates in the slow, late morning haze of the library. When Doug spots Frank shove open the revolving doors, he pulls himself up cautiously like a hedgehog, and signals with his eyebrows to his crew for assistance. Frank, his guitar case slung over his shoulder, strides directly towards him. He pauses, glares at him for a spell, then swivels and meanders over to Captain Crunch. Crunch rises, prepared to duel. Frank begins to assemble his guitar. He pivots to accompany Crunch at the checkerboard.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Sarah sits with a drink and suitcase when Bert enters her suite. He tries to kiss her, but she's unresponsive. After he leaves, she smokes a cigarette and enters his room. Meanwhile, Eddie returns, ignores a policeman, and retrieves a package from the concierge. He heads upstairs, finds money on Sarah's bed, and notices a crowd in the adjoining room. He sees Bert talking to a plainclothesman while a photographer takes pictures. Eddie pushes past to find Sarah's body on the bathroom floor. Distraught, he almost touches her before confronting Bert, grabbing him by the throat. A policeman separates them, but Eddie breaks free. Later, at Ames, Minnesota Fats sits absorbed in a newspaper while Bert, wary of Eddie’s arrival, is near the cashier’s cage. Eddie confidently approaches Bert but turns to play pool with Fats instead.
